blog.name: adanylovinsideblog
blog.title: Dracarys: burn the bish
blog.description:
The only truth I recognize in this blog is King’s Landing was a pyre too small for Missandei of Naath

(also my main blog is whostheweebnow, so if they reply to you thats me sorry lol)

tags: there probably more but im too angry  to continue
summary: I’m just going to go down a fucking list of issues I had with this episode: 1) the scene where Jon gets all the credit for...
body:
I’m just going to go down a fucking list of issues I had with this episode:

1) the scene where Jon gets all the credit for Danny’s accomplishments. While I actually think this is what D&D where trying to set up, to make people fell for Danny, it still drive me crazy that so many people seemed to have missed it anyway.

2) why the fuck are the northerners still against her? Arya said it herself, they needed her . They’d all be dead without her. Also since when do the northern lords care about northern independence. Robb had to practically force some of them to fight for him. They had no problems bending the knee to the Bolton’s who knelt to Cersei fucking Lannister. And now we’re supposed to buy Daenerys is just too much. They were fine with Cersei. But the woman that risked everything to save them was too much.

3) also why would they have a problem with a forgein or Southern Queen? They were fine with Cersei and before that was Talisa, born and raised in Essos. Danny was at least born in Westeros.

4) I’m also getting really sick of this “Jon is too honest to keep secrets or lie shit”. He literally lied to the Wildlings for months, the women he loved for months. He has let everyone in the North believe he bent the knee for Danny’s army, never correcting them that she vowed to fight before that. But now when it’s convenient to the plot he just can’t keep a secret. When its Daenerys’ life and future on the line.

5) Also people need to stop acting like Danny was even kind of a bad guy in that scene. This was her future and her life on the line. All Jon had to do was not tell anyone and she would be fine. If he truley didn’t want the throne there was no reason not to tell anyone. And she was fucking right! People are already turning on her and plotting to kill her bc he opened his godamn mouth. Well at least he made Sam happy.

6) why the fuck are Sansa and Arya still against Daenerys. At this point this is some Cersei level backstabbing. Danny sacrifices half her army for you and her most loyal advisor, plus her best chance at the throne. And you still mistrust her? For what reason? She’s given them no reason. She has gone out of her way to make peace with Sansa. If they still dislike her at this point it’s for much less pure motives.

7) GHOST


8) that whole war council scene. Jon comes off as whipped and Danny comes of as out of control. All of it was ooc and it was trash. Plus, Danny isn’t wrong. She waited and Cersei doubles her army. If she waits even longer Cersei might triple it, move against them and Sansa will continue to undermine her support. It’s literally no longer safe for her here since Jon spilled the beans. If she doesn’t get the throne now people will start to conspire to put Jon in her place.

9) Danny wanting to attack KL. While a) out of character (considering she just spent all of season 7 losing the war to avoid doing exactly that and risked her chance at the throne to save the lives of millions of innocent people and now I’m supposed to believe she doesn’t care so long as she can have the thrones. 🙄 ) it’s also not a ‘crazy’ tactic. Literally every single person who has taken King Landing or any city or castle has murdered thousands of innocent people to do so and not a single one of them were called mad for it.

10) The Starks have married aunts to nephew before or at least niece to uncle. stop talking. Stop Talking SHUT UP. LEARN YOURE GODDMAN SHIT IF YOURE GOING TO MAKE A FUCKING SHOW ON IT

11) Varys saying dicks matter. Varys. Who has actively ridiculed men for thinking with their dicks. 🙂he thinks it would be better to have a man on the throne bc he has a dick. 🙃

12) how the FUCK did no one see Euron? How the fuck did they hit Rhaegal and not Drogon? 🙃🙃🙃🙃

13) literally all the rest of the fucking ep.

14) Fucking Jaime. 😡😡😡😡😡😡

15) MISSANDEI OF FUCKING NAATH🤬🤬🤬🔥🔥🔥🔥🤬🤬🤬🔥🔥🔥

reblog.comment:
I’m just going to go down a fucking list of issues I had with this episode:

1) the scene where Jon gets all the credit for Danny’s accomplishments. While I actually think this is what D&D where trying to set up, to make people fell for Danny, it still drive me crazy that so many people seemed to have missed it anyway.

2) why the fuck are the northerners still against her? Arya said it herself, they needed her . They’d all be dead without her. Also since when do the northern lords care about northern independence. Robb had to practically force some of them to fight for him. They had no problems bending the knee to the Bolton’s who knelt to Cersei fucking Lannister. And now we’re supposed to buy Daenerys is just too much. They were fine with Cersei. But the woman that risked everything to save them was too much.

3) also why would they have a problem with a forgein or Southern Queen? They were fine with Cersei and before that was Talisa, born and raised in Essos. Danny was at least born in Westeros.

4) I’m also getting really sick of this “Jon is too honest to keep secrets or lie shit”. He literally lied to the Wildlings for months, the women he loved for months. He has let everyone in the North believe he bent the knee for Danny’s army, never correcting them that she vowed to fight before that. But now when it’s convenient to the plot he just can’t keep a secret. When its Daenerys’ life and future on the line.

5) Also people need to stop acting like Danny was even kind of a bad guy in that scene. This was her future and her life on the line. All Jon had to do was not tell anyone and she would be fine. If he truley didn’t want the throne there was no reason not to tell anyone. And she was fucking right! People are already turning on her and plotting to kill her bc he opened his godamn mouth. Well at least he made Sam happy.

6) why the fuck are Sansa and Arya still against Daenerys. At this point this is some Cersei level backstabbing. Danny sacrifices half her army for you and her most loyal advisor, plus her best chance at the throne. And you still mistrust her? For what reason? She’s given them no reason. She has gone out of her way to make peace with Sansa. If they still dislike her at this point it’s for much less pure motives.

7) GHOST


8) that whole war council scene. Jon comes off as whipped and Danny comes of as out of control. All of it was ooc and it was trash. Plus, Danny isn’t wrong. She waited and Cersei doubles her army. If she waits even longer Cersei might triple it, move against them and Sansa will continue to undermine her support. It’s literally no longer safe for her here since Jon spilled the beans. If she doesn’t get the throne now people will start to conspire to put Jon in her place.

9) Danny wanting to attack KL. While a) out of character (considering she just spent all of season 7 losing the war to avoid doing exactly that and risked her chance at the throne to save the lives of millions of innocent people and now I’m supposed to believe she doesn’t care so long as she can have the thrones. 🙄 ) it’s also not a ‘crazy’ tactic. Literally every single person who has taken King Landing or any city or castle has murdered thousands of innocent people to do so and not a single one of them were called mad for it.

10) The Starks have married aunts to nephew before or at least niece to uncle. stop talking. Stop Talking SHUT UP. LEARN YOURE GODDMAN SHIT IF YOURE GOING TO MAKE A FUCKING SHOW ON IT

11) Varys saying dicks matter. Varys. Who has actively ridiculed men for thinking with their dicks. 🙂he thinks it would be better to have a man on the throne bc he has a dick. 🙃

12) how the FUCK did no one see Euron? How the fuck did they hit Rhaegal and not Drogon? 🙃🙃🙃🙃

13) literally all the rest of the fucking ep.

14) Fucking Jaime. 😡😡😡😡😡😡

15) MISSANDEI OF FUCKING NAATH🤬🤬🤬🔥🔥🔥🔥🤬🤬🤬🔥🔥🔥

If she waits even longer Cersei might triple it, move against them and Sansa will continue to undermine her support. It’s literally no longer safe for her here since Jon spilled the beans. 12) how the FUCK did no one see Euron? How the fuck did they hit Rhaegal and not Drogon? 🙃🙃🙃🙃

13) literally all the rest of the fucking ep.

14) Fucking Jaime. 😡😡😡😡😡😡

summary:
im so excited to see dany burn the entirety of Kings landing to the ground 
I'm so excited for cersei to learn that Jaime...
body:
im so excited to see dany burn the entirety of Kings landing to the ground

I’m so excited for cersei to learn that Jaime doesn’t love her

I’m so excited to see Jon die some brutal death bc I’m bored by him

I’m so excited to see Arya and the hound team up to kill the mountain

I’m so excited to see dany rule the six kingdoms and sansa rule the north

I’m so excited to see Arya and gendry have a happy ending

I’m so excited to see brienne kick some ass and get Jaime back

I have such high expectations pls let this MESS of a show come through for me

not having sex does not lower your value as a person
summary: Okay but we need to call out that that last episode of game of thrones because Brienne and her virginity was handled in a very...
body: Okay but we need to call out that that last episode of game of thrones because Brienne and her virginity was handled in a very ugly way. Being a Virgin is NOT 👏something 👏to be 👏 ashamed👏 of👏 and you don’t need ‘fixing!’ Someone made her feel bad about it and so she felt pressured to have sex and that’s not okay! That is NOT romantic guys!

summary: What did you think of the convo between Sansa and the Hound in GoT on Sunday ???? Or aren't you a Sansan fan? I thought that you...
question: What did you think of the convo between Sansa and the Hound in GoT on Sunday ???? Or aren't you a Sansan fan? I thought that you wrote that you are, but maybe that was Senlinyu... Anyway, if you have opinions I'd love to know your thoughts and (greedy) how you might do it differently!
answer:
I only recently found out about how much more detail there is in the books for Sansan through @baileyblueroan, but I was absolutely giddy watching any interaction.

His relationships with the Stark girls are my fave on the show!

summary: Read Game of Thrones’ Natalie Emmanuel a.k.a Missandei’s Goodbye Post to the Show
title: Read Game of Thrones’ Natalie Emmanuel a.k.a Missandei’s Goodbye Post to the Show
body:
Read Game of Thrones’ Natalie Emmanuel a.k.a Missandei’s Goodbye Post to the Show

Well, the headline has already spoiled the latest episode of Game of Thrones.

One of everyone’s fave stars of the show Missandei of Naath played by Natalie Emmanuel was killed, by none other than Cersei.

Missandei was captured by Cersei’s army and was killed when Daenerys refused to surrender.

In an emotional post on Instagram, Natalie said:

It’s been one of my greatest joys playing Missandei of…

View On WordPress

summary: Read this terrific and amazing threat on Twitter about Daenerys, her character both in the show/books, and thought it would be...
body:
Read this terrific and amazing threat on Twitter about Daenerys, her character both in the show/books, and thought it would be good to post it here on Tumblr after this past episodes. 

All credit due to @ terrible_help, so please go there and RT and like it because it is a very well thought and explained one.

I really need to talk about a scene from last night’s episode of Game of Thrones. This is one of the most shocking pieces of dialogue that the show has ever offered up. I’m talking about Dany’s willingnes to commit genocide:

I feel I need to preface this thread by saying that I think Dany is probably the best character on GoT. She’s not my favourite, but very few of the others are as beautifully realised as she is. The last two seasons have not changed that view. They have just reinforced it.

She’s pretty unique in all the fiction I’ve read, and I think she’ll be considered GRRM’s greatest achievement long after he’s gone. Not because she’s the hero of the tale but precisely because she isn’t. Dany’s story has always been destined for a great tragedy.

There has always been the foreboding feeling that her motivations for wanting the iron throne never quite made sense, but for a long time that worry was secondary to her own survival; something that didn’t need to be addressed while assassins and kings were trying to kill her.

We need to address it now, however. Part of the reason we tended to overlook the darker implication of her ambition was because she was forced rise up against her enemies just to survive, but at some point you need to examine the choices and the allies you’ve made along the way.

Was there really ever any justification for setting the dothraki, a culture of enslavers who acknowledge only power, and rape and pillage their way across the world, onto the path to Westeros just to take the throne?

There’s a scene early on in the books where she sees the dothraki raping a young woman whose family they have just murdered, and she silently thinks to herself through tears that this is the cost of war. And she accepts it.

Was there ever a throne to rightfully take back, considering her father tried to burn the country alive before being cast down, or that her ancestors conquered the continent and forged the throne to force the seven kingdoms into servitude?

Dany doesn’t know these facts because of Viserys’s lies, but she learns them during her journey, and still she persists. The irony is that she had everything in Meereen. She had a people, a man who loved her, a purpose that was purer than her reasons for conquering Westeros.

Freeing slaves is easy when you have the power to do so, but in Westeros her family were the masters who rode in on their winged warheads and burned people with impunity until they submitted. Invisible chains are still chains.

Her birthright is no longer valid on account of her father being replaced, and evils committed against innocent children in her family do not justify other evils committed in the name of taking back a throne that is nothing but a tool of oppression.

If A Song of Ice and Fire is a reference work to Lord of the Rings (and it is) then the throne itself is the ring. It’s the absolute power that corrupts absolutely. It’s the wheel Aegon built, which Dany once claimed she wanted to break but now wants to put back up on its axis.

Her comment was taken by Tyrion as a desire to build a better world, but it must be seen by the viewers in light of Dany’s motivation to grab and hold power. And it is increasingly clear now that she meant to ensure no one else will ever be powerful enough to rise up against her.

This is why Jon’s parentage has been saved for a final confrontation: it’s not because he has a better claim on account of being ahead in the line of succession to a cast down king. It’s because it invalidates Dany’s pretext for wanting to rule. This season finally unmasked her.

Without it she is a conqueror who wants to grab power because she can. She prides herself on ending slavery, but her family enslaved Westeros for centuries. You can’t on one hand be the breaker of chains and on the other force people into submission under threat of death.

This is something Cersei, Stannis, Tywin and Roose Bolton would also have done. But they are antagonists in this story precisely because of their willingness to view human lives as expendable in their quest for power and validation.

… Which brings us back to the original post. Dany was ready to level King’s Landing long before Missandei got beheaded. The conversation between her and her advisors on a ship headed for King’s Landing, towards the end of 8x04, makes that abundantly clear:

(pic above, that dialogue of ep. 4)

She’s literally saying: ”Let’s offer Cersei a deal she’ll obviously never take just so people know it’s her fault when I slaughter them by the thousands.” There is no other way to interpret that comment, and the silence of her advisors speaks volumes. They’re horrified.

Dany is not turning into her father. She’s turning into something different, beyond madness. She believes herself to be righteous because she answers to no one else but herself, and everything she does is demanded by destiny. The hubris of her character has come full circle.

Tyranny can’t be ended through more tyranny. A better world can’t be built through conquest, it just can’t. And it can’t be built by someone who thinks that genocide is a small price that others should pay in order for her to acquire what she perceives as rightfully being hers.

A friend commented that this is a real life parallel to how people are stanning and cheering on military acts of utter horror, and it sums up one of the most important lessons of aSoIaF. This is not a story about restoring the lineage of kings.

Evil is a banal act by nature, but the path leading up to committing it is complicated. People aren’t born wanting to murder children. They don’t set out to kill or maim or to dole out biblical justice everywhere they see fit.

Dany once wanted a life in peace and it was denied her by people who feared what she could become instead of having compassion for what she was. They forced her out on a journey that made her see the world in terms of sheep and dragons.

And if a better world will ever be built, this worldview will have to be discarded. It’s not the solution to the plight of Westeros. It’s very much a part of the problem.

– by Carl from Twitter. (https://twitter.com/terrible_help/status/1125442845010219016)

Read this terrific and amazing threat on Twitter about Daenerys, her character both in the show/books, and thought it would be good to post it here on Tumblr after this past episodes. 

All credit due to @ terrible_help, so please go there and RT and like it because it is a very well thought and explained one.

I really need to talk about a scene from last night’s episode of Game of Thrones. This is one of the most shocking pieces of dialogue that the show has ever offered up. I’m talking about Dany’s willingnes to commit genocide:

I feel I need to preface this thread by saying that I think Dany is probably the best character on GoT. She’s not my favourite, but very few of the others are as beautifully realised as she is. The last two seasons have not changed that view. They have just reinforced it.

She’s pretty unique in all the fiction I’ve read, and I think she’ll be considered GRRM’s greatest achievement long after he’s gone. Not because she’s the hero of the tale but precisely because she isn’t. Dany’s story has always been destined for a great tragedy.

There has always been the foreboding feeling that her motivations for wanting the iron throne never quite made sense, but for a long time that worry was secondary to her own survival; something that didn’t need to be addressed while assassins and kings were trying to kill her.

We need to address it now, however. Part of the reason we tended to overlook the darker implication of her ambition was because she was forced rise up against her enemies just to survive, but at some point you need to examine the choices and the allies you’ve made along the way.

Was there really ever any justification for setting the dothraki, a culture of enslavers who acknowledge only power, and rape and pillage their way across the world, onto the path to Westeros just to take the throne?

There’s a scene early on in the books where she sees the dothraki raping a young woman whose family they have just murdered, and she silently thinks to herself through tears that this is the cost of war. And she accepts it.

Was there ever a throne to rightfully take back, considering her father tried to burn the country alive before being cast down, or that her ancestors conquered the continent and forged the throne to force the seven kingdoms into servitude?

Dany doesn’t know these facts because of Viserys’s lies, but she learns them during her journey, and still she persists. The irony is that she had everything in Meereen. She had a people, a man who loved her, a purpose that was purer than her reasons for conquering Westeros.

Freeing slaves is easy when you have the power to do so, but in Westeros her family were the masters who rode in on their winged warheads and burned people with impunity until they submitted. Invisible chains are still chains.

Her birthright is no longer valid on account of her father being replaced, and evils committed against innocent children in her family do not justify other evils committed in the name of taking back a throne that is nothing but a tool of oppression.

If A Song of Ice and Fire is a reference work to Lord of the Rings (and it is) then the throne itself is the ring. It’s the absolute power that corrupts absolutely. It’s the wheel Aegon built, which Dany once claimed she wanted to break but now wants to put back up on its axis.

Her comment was taken by Tyrion as a desire to build a better world, but it must be seen by the viewers in light of Dany’s motivation to grab and hold power. And it is increasingly clear now that she meant to ensure no one else will ever be powerful enough to rise up against her.

This is why Jon’s parentage has been saved for a final confrontation: it’s not because he has a better claim on account of being ahead in the line of succession to a cast down king. It’s because it invalidates Dany’s pretext for wanting to rule. This season finally unmasked her.

Without it she is a conqueror who wants to grab power because she can. She prides herself on ending slavery, but her family enslaved Westeros for centuries. You can’t on one hand be the breaker of chains and on the other force people into submission under threat of death.

This is something Cersei, Stannis, Tywin and Roose Bolton would also have done. But they are antagonists in this story precisely because of their willingness to view human lives as expendable in their quest for power and validation.

… Which brings us back to the original post. Dany was ready to level King’s Landing long before Missandei got beheaded. The conversation between her and her advisors on a ship headed for King’s Landing, towards the end of 8x04, makes that abundantly clear:

(pic above, that dialogue of ep. 4)

She’s literally saying: ”Let’s offer Cersei a deal she’ll obviously never take just so people know it’s her fault when I slaughter them by the thousands.” There is no other way to interpret that comment, and the silence of her advisors speaks volumes. They’re horrified.

Dany is not turning into her father. She’s turning into something different, beyond madness. She believes herself to be righteous because she answers to no one else but herself, and everything she does is demanded by destiny. The hubris of her character has come full circle.

Tyranny can’t be ended through more tyranny. A better world can’t be built through conquest, it just can’t. And it can’t be built by someone who thinks that genocide is a small price that others should pay in order for her to acquire what she perceives as rightfully being hers.

A friend commented that this is a real life parallel to how people are stanning and cheering on military acts of utter horror, and it sums up one of the most important lessons of aSoIaF. This is not a story about restoring the lineage of kings.

Evil is a banal act by nature, but the path leading up to committing it is complicated. People aren’t born wanting to murder children. They don’t set out to kill or maim or to dole out biblical justice everywhere they see fit.

Dany once wanted a life in peace and it was denied her by people who feared what she could become instead of having compassion for what she was. They forced her out on a journey that made her see the world in terms of sheep and dragons.

And if a better world will ever be built, this worldview will have to be discarded. It’s not the solution to the plight of Westeros. It’s very much a part of the problem.

– by Carl from Twitter. (https://twitter.com/terrible_help/status/1125442845010219016)

blog.description: I have opinions. You don't have to think the same as me. But I also love to call out bullshit and start up conversations in fandoms and shippers, so interact if you agree, or bugger off if you don't

summary: Idiots who claim Sansa is DnDs precious fave????
title: Idiots who claim Sansa is DnDs precious fave????
body: They are literally the assholes who gave her the plotline where she is brutally raped and beaten by a husband she doesn’t even have in the books. GRRM has Sansa still in the Vale, courting Harry Hardying, and still under the thumb of Littlefinger posing as Alayne Stone. Jeyne Poole is the one who marries Ramsay, pretending she is Arya Stark, and is forcibly taken by Ramsay. She suffered something never intended for her character, so please stop acting like she is some mary sue who never pays for her actions and has plot armor. The girl has been beaten, humiliated, threatened, assaulted, raped, and dragged through hell and back, and it only made her stronger and smarter.

summary: So I refuse to believe in Jaime's death...
body:
So I refuse to believe in Jaime’s death…

Hear me out: he will kill Cersie. That’s for sure. And it’s not gonna be easy for him. He will be hurt. And bleeding. Jaime probably will loose another hand. Or will be stabed. And they will make us believe that he’s dead. But than the epilogue shows him alive. That’s how I see this.

reblog.comment:

body:
So…

You wanna tell me that at any point, in every leak, in all spoilers Jaime will die with Cersie and Brienne is absolutely useless?!

LIKE WTF?! WHY EVERYONE SO CONSISTENT ABOUT IT? WHEN IT EVEN DOESN’T MAKE SENSE AT NARRATIVE POINT OF VIEW! WHOLE JAIME’S ARC CAN’T BE RUIN IN LITERALLY EVERY SCENARIO.

Like with every another character all leaks kinda different between each other, but Jaime is always dead? And Brienne’s was need for the plot just to become heartbroken poor thing? Bullshit. BULLSHIT. I bet it’s all for fan’s distraction.

Thank you for coming on my TEDTalk.

reblog.comment:
So…

You wanna tell me that at any point, in every leak, in all spoilers Jaime will die with Cersie and Brienne is absolutely useless?!

LIKE WTF?! WHY EVERYONE SO CONSISTENT ABOUT IT? WHEN IT EVEN DOESN’T MAKE SENSE AT NARRATIVE POINT OF VIEW! WHOLE JAIME’S ARC CAN’T BE RUIN IN LITERALLY EVERY SCENARIO.

Like with every another character all leaks kinda different between each other, but Jaime is always dead? And Brienne’s was need for the plot just to become heartbroken poor thing? Bullshit. BULLSHIT. I bet it’s all for fan’s distraction.

Thank you for coming on my TEDTalk.
